page.title: 16FARMYARDS, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
There are 22 farmyards in this area, most built of bricks and slates. Three are no longer farms. One was a stud. Six have no new buildings but have utilised or demolished old units as necessary. One farm has an old round house for horsework. Twelve have new buildings made of concrete blocks, corregated asbestos and wood slats. 1 has traditional brick built additions.
These new structures are used for milking parlours, bull pens, winter stalls, calf and bullock rearing, slurry pits, storing grain and silage.
Most farms are owned by Sandon Estate, one by another landlord, 3 are owner occupied. One of these has new build- ings in a field away from the house to avoid a B road and level crossing.
